Super Hydorah is a shining example of the retro kind of game you still want to play today. Graphics and sound are spot on to deliver the whole oldschool feel the game is going for. The game has an R-Type / Gradius kind of vibe to it, and also delivers on quantity and quality of content. 
There are lots of different stages that all have a different theme to them. And that doesnt just mean different graphics, also different hazards and enemies. One time you have to navigate through an asteroid field, next time you take on a huge fleet of battleships, and then you fly through some plants that grow around you. So the game will give you a very diverse experience.
Each time you beat a level, you also get a new primary-, secondary-, or bomb kind of weapon, and you can freely choose between those whenever you choose your next level. Yeah you can choose your next level too. There are different paths you can take to play through the game. Its not a very complex structure, but it is enough to give you some options to try out when you dont feel like you want to try a stage for the 5th time in a row. And until you became somewhat good at this game you will try and try again. 
If oldschool shoot'em ups are your kind of thing, you need to play Super Hydorah. It is crafted with love and care.

38391263.review:
I kept meaning to write a review about this game since it came out, but procrastination got the better of me.

I originally played the freeware Hydorah several years ago and liked it enough to give the developer, Locomalito, some donation money. When I heard Super Hydorah was being made, I of course jumped on it as soon as it was released. 

The traditional horizontal shooter style reminds me the most of Gradius. Spefically the Gradius IV/Gradius Gaiden era of the series. This also extends to the music, which has that funky jazz fusion/rock vibe. The controls, gameplay mechanics, and power up system is simple enough where you can dive into it immediately. It provides a good challenge but isn't overwhelmingly daunting. It has multiple paths and several hidden secrets to keep you invested in it. I especially like the fact that you can save/load your progress and pickup on where you left off at any time as you traverse through the multiple paths to the end. 

Overall, I'm going to echo what was mostly said about this game already and say that it is very well crafted. The dev was obviously mindful of the elements that make a good traditional shooter and was sure to craft that into this game. The Gryzor87 composed soundtrack is great too. "No Mercy" in particular I enjoy. For the shooting game fan of any type, this is definitely a must have game.

38275948.review:
Super Hydorah est un bel hommage aux SHMUP old school de la fin des années 80 (Gradius, Darius, R-Type...)
Il propose un armement varié, plusieurs routes possibles et un challenge relevé, sans être frustrant.

Les points positifs :
- des contrôles parfait. Le vaisseau est très maniable, on dispose d'un autofire qui évitera les douleurs articulaires.
- le système d'armement qu'on récupère au fur et à mesure des missions permet une montée en puissance progressive du vaisseau qui est très agrébale. On ne se retrouve pas au max de puissance dès le niveau 2 comme dans Gradius.
- la difficulté est progressive. À chaque partie, on se trouve juste à l'extérieur de notre zone de confort et on progresse un peu plus.
- les musiques sont de bonnes qualité, certaines sont même excellentes.
- les morts sont punitives mais pas trop ; on perd une partie de son armement mais on ne se retrouve pas "à poil".
- le jeu reconnait les contrôleurs exotiques (ma manette PS1 avec adaptateur USB est reconnu de premier coup).
- le jeu est dur mais pas frustrant, chaque mort est parfaitement compréhensible. On n'a pas l'impression de survivre par un coup de chance (comme dans Gradius) mais plutôt de mourir à cause d'une erreur de placement ou de non-anticipation tout à fait identifiable.

Les points neutres: :
- les graphismes sont jolis sans être époustouflants. Certains décors sont assez vides (mais d'un autre côté cela permet une bonne lisibilité) et parfois de qualité inégale.
- Certaines armes me semblent assez anedoctiques (comme le tir chargé) mais peut-être n'ai-je pas suffisament creusé le jeu.

Les points négatifs :
- une seule sauvegarde à la fois. Si l'on est près de la fin du jeu, impossible de commencer une nouvelle partie sans perdre toute sa progression.
- pas de leaderboard online (à moins que j'ai raté quelque chose). D'un autre côté, le scoring n'est pas particulièrement développé donc ce n'est pas très grave.
- pas de mode entrainement comme on peut le voir sur les portages Cave. Mais au moins cela oblige à le faire "à l'ancienne" et on retire une satisfaction à passer tous les niveaux, même en "credit-feed"

En résumé, le prix de lancement à 12 € était très intéressant. À 20 boules, je le recommande pour les nostalgiques de Gradius, vous ne regretterez pas votre investissement.
Pour les autres, mettez le dans votre liste de souhait et attendez une promotion, il vaut le coup d'essayer.
Et dans tous les cas, testez les autres jeux de Locomalito (Maldita Castilla, notamment) !

38147868.review:
This is the sickest traditional shoot-em-up I've ever played.

Super Hydorah is oozing with quality. I won't bore you by talking about how great the artwork & music are, just look at the trailer & demo for those. What I would like to mention is how incredibly dialed in the game play is. These guys have mastered the art of making 5-10 projectiles a serious threat, they don't need 5,000 bullets to do that. The game design carefully rewards spatial awareness, reaction time & tactics, over rote memorization and extreme precision. It's difficult, you're gonna die a lot, but the deaths come with minimal frustration. Almost every time I've died, it's provoked a shrug and a "Alright that was a fair call" sentiment. I would say this game is both more difficult, and more fair than any of the great classics, gradius 1/2/3, salamander/life force, etc. 2 player mode is great, if you've got someone that will sit on the couch with you for some good old fashioned gradius fun, definitely give it a try.

The ship uprade system is overall very good. The weapon choices you have before each level are meaningful decisions. Death only knocks a little bit of power off your primary & secondary weapons, which is a lot nicer than sending you back to the stone age every time you fly into a wall. It's difficult at first to build up many speed & special attack upgrades, but the game is managable even when your ship has lost most of it's power. I've had to resort to killing most bosses on my first play through with a peashooter and no speed upgrades left.

I've got a couple minor nitpicks, but they're mostly subjective stuff and shouldn't discourage anyone from trying the game out:

1) I wish there was a little more red & blue color on the ships in 2P mode. When you're flying level, there's only about 5 pixels of identifying color which can make it difficult to tell them apart, especially if your housemate is RUDE and insists on equipping the same weapons as you for each level.
2) It's a little difficult to experiment with special weapons when you're a beginner. I see the need to decrement your special weapon charge count by one on death, that's a good call. But maybe you could be kind enough to only decrement us down to 1 in stead of all the way to 0. ;)

Super Hydorah is a fantastic horizontal shoot 'em up with varied levels and weapons, a killer soundtrack and great graphics. As a fan of games like R-Type and Gradius / Parodius I'm very happy that this game exists and even more that the old freeware version got the "Super" treatment. While the game borrows many elements from classic titles, it feels fresh and unique. Unlike most other shooters of this kind, Super Hydorah supports analog controls. At first I wasn't a fan of this, but after a while I got used to it and even with maxed out speed upgrades you can still maneuver precisely. There are also secrets to find in each stage.

Shoot 'em up veterans will have no problems blazing through the game and even a 1CC run is achievable for most players. That's not to say that the game is easy. The levels are challenging, but fair. Checkpoints within levels and a save system after each stage help newcomers. There are unlimited continues, but if you run out of lives you get send back to the start of the level. Some stages are pretty long and new players might have some trouble beating them. But with the right combination of weapons, sub weapons and bombs every stage and boss can be conquered.

感谢奶牛关的野蔷薇计划和开发者让我评测这款游戏

小时候从FC时代酷爱宇宙巡航机，R Type这类横向卷轴射击游戏。这款Super Hydorah从一开始就表明了向宇宙巡航机系列致敬的态度。总的来说玩Super Hydorah给我的感觉像是玩SFC上的宇宙巡航机续作的感觉

由于是致敬向作品，本文可能大多数时候拿本作和宇宙巡航机比较

[b]画面：[/b]

典型的16位像素风格画面，场景细节刻画还算细致。大量的小兵/boss造型都是和宇宙巡航机十分类似。游戏中还提供选项模拟街机上那种晶体管显示器的视觉效果


[b]音乐：[/b]

关卡中的音乐大多数是轻摇滚曲风/电子风，比较平庸

[b]操作：[/b]

游戏支持手柄操作（我就是用手柄游玩的），要用到的按键非常少：方向键，主武器，副武器，菜单。操作起来感觉十分流畅，按住主武器键可以连射简直是射击游戏玩家福音

[b]系统：[/b]

游戏系统虽然借鉴了宇宙巡航机，但是有自己独创新。游戏通过击败敌人掉落升级武器的道具提升飞机火力（绿色提升主武器，红色提升副武器），武器一共有10级，每5级主武器会有火力的提升。这个设计虽然字面上看上去会让人觉得火力提升较慢，但是相对的，死亡也仅仅失去2级提升，使得游戏死亡惩罚相对宇宙巡航机不是那么大

此外击杀特殊敌人会掉落护盾/加速/炸弹，特殊敌人每关数量较少，所以收集和保持护盾和加速在游戏中比较重要

击杀boss后会解锁新的主/副武器以及炸弹。与宇宙巡航机一上来就选择一个固定的飞机不同，在每关开始前玩家可以针对对应不同关卡选择不同武器组合


分歧关卡让玩家有一定选择权，但是意义有限

Game Over之后可以无限接关，游戏在照顾射击游戏新手这方面可以说比较到位

[b]关卡设计：[/b]

游戏整体关卡设计从障碍物到杂兵分布和宇宙巡航机如出一辙，敌人子弹速度适中，子弹密集程度也是远低于世面上的弹幕游戏，也没有那种初见杀式的陷阱。虽然游戏看似简单，但是要求玩家在游玩时精神集中。而boss战目前看也相对简单，摸清boss攻击方式之后基本可以轻松通过


[b]总结一下优缺点

+ 优秀的操作感

+ 关卡设计合理

+ 对于新手上手难度较为简单

- 分歧路线并非二选一，(目前看来)没有多周目必要

- 缺乏难度选择

- 太刻意学习宇宙巡航机，缺乏自身特点​​​​[/b]

[h1]如果是宇宙巡航机的粉丝/热爱飞行射击类游戏的话，推荐入手。否则推荐打折时候入手[/h1]


First of all, a huge thanks to the game developer and cowlevel give me a copy of the game for the review.

Since I love Gradius Series on the Famicom(japanese NES) and played a lot as a kid, I like to see more Indi vertical 2D shooter. At the first moment playing this game, I can feel that the game developer try to make this game to honor the classic Gradius (especially the Gradius III on the SNES).

After 5 Hrs of play time, I could definitive say, that I feel I played a sequel to the Gradius III on the SNES. Since the Super Hydorah is heavily inspired by the Gradius Series, be prepared that will be a lot of comparison between this game and Gradius.


[b]Graphics:[/b]

This game has typical 16-Bit graphics, the sprites of player fighter and enemy are well-animated. The design of some enemy and bosses is very similiar to Gradius. This game also offers the option change graphical settings to simulate an arcade game experience


[b]Music:[/b]

Super Hydorah's music is kind of rock/electronic, just mediocre. But it definitely remind me the music of Gradius.

[b]Control:[/b]

Super Hydorah's control is very simple and smooth. I'm using a Dualshock-controller and didn't feel any delay. One thing to point out: You can hold the shoot button to shoot non-stop, which is a big releaf for players.

Gameplay:

Although this game is a tribute to Gradius, it has its own innovation. By destroying enemies you gain red/green power-ups, which buffs your main/sub weapon. There are 10 levels of power-up, each 5 gives you an upgrade to your weapon. On the plus side, you only lose 2 levels when dying, unlike in Gradius, you lose every upgrade when dying. But every power-up don't give you remarkable boost. 

Killing special enemies gives you shield/speed boost/bomb, but such enemies are relatively rare in the level.

Defeating bosses unlocks new weapon/sub-weapon/bomb, and you can customize your arsenal before every stage which is very handy, unlike in Gradius, your weapon is defined at the start of the game by choosing the fighter. 


But the divergent path/level system dosn't make any sence to me since you can play both of the stages in a single playthrough, so what's the point for multiple playthrough?


The player get unlimited continues after game over which is very fair(especially for new players).

[b]Level design:[/b]

The level design and enemy pattern is heavily inspired by Gradius. The projectile speed is moderate and there is no unfair trap. If player died, it has to be its own fault. The general difficulty is lower than the most shooting game in the market. Compare to the noraml enemies, the bosses are relatively easy once the player get the pattern of the boss.


[b]Summery:

+ Smooth controls

+ Very fair level design

+ Easy for new players to pick up and play

- Replayability (not sure, will update after I beat this game)

I am not gonna say anything that has been already said. Super Hydorah is a top ten game. Level design, secrets, arms, music, difficulty... All amazing and very well balance.

I would like to mention the continue system, if you understand the philosophy of the developer and the connection his work has with the arcade world, you will understand this system.
When you lose the game you will have the option to continue, if you decide to continue you will lose different things: some ship upgrades, points, you will go back to the beginning of the stage, and also you will see a different ending if you finish the game.
This punishment creates tension on your game play, similar to the one when playing arcade games with real coins. And this is brilliant, the way you play changes dramatically. You feel the rush when you are about to die, you know there is a punishment if you don't perform well enough. If you could continue without consequences like in most of the present games you wouldn't have this feeling.

Locomalito is an archeologist of the video games art. He studies let's say what video games have existed till a particular year, then he released a game that could fit perfectly on that year, thinking on the technology limitations of that particular time. He mimics, pixel art, sounds, style, game play, etc. You can see some examples of that on his catalogue: a master piece for ZX Spectrum called " l'Abbaye des Morts " (it could have been released on 1986), an arcade cabinet called " Death came from Verminest " (it could have been released on 1981). Who would take the time in creating such a games and self imposing the visual technical limitations of those specific years? not to mention doing that for free.
Super Hydorah is a really good game, but also you will appreciate its full potential if you have a well understanding of the Video games as an art form.
And you can apply all I said here to the music, Gryzor87 has done an amazing job, if you don't believe me just wait till you arrive to the level called Verminest on Super Hydorah.

35180494.review:
A super well done retro shoot em up. It clearly takes heavy inspiration from games like Gradius, but while feeling modern and polished.

If you have experience with Gradius and liked it, you'll definitely like this. (I personally find it much better and far less frustrating than Gradius.)

If you don't have experience with games like Gradius but ya like shmups, this can still very well be quite appealing for you.

So, onto some basic things the game has:

Your GUNS. You have various weapons at your disposal, specifcally: A Main weapon, a secondary weapon (like mines that shoot below you) and a bomb or active weapon that you get charges to use via a certain powerup. Most levels gives a new weapon unlock upon completion to add to what you can choose from. This can lead to some unique loadouts and even some neat synergies.

POWERUPS. There aren't many, which is fine for a game like this. There are little green orbs and red orbs you'll come across often. When you max out on either your fire power/fire rate will improve. Then there are the main big "3" power ups that you kill special enemies to get. This powerup, when dropped, alternates between a shield, an active weapon use, and speed/mobility upgrade. 

Usually, you want to get a shield if you lack one as it protects you from a hit before dying, and then go for the other two. You can have a total of three active weapon charges and the same goes with the speed upgrades. And when you die you lose some of all your power ups.

LEVELS. The levels (from what I've done so far) are very well made and even hold some secrets. They all feel fair and I never felt a death wasn't my fault. Every boss is significantly different from the others and the pacing of the game is very nice as is the difficulty curve. 

There are a lot of levels as well. This is an obvious gud thing. And as it says in the features list, the order of what levels you go through are non-linear! There are some branching paths in the level select screen so you can go through one set of levels or the other. There are also some "special" levels which are designed to be extra difficult but also reward a neat item.

AN OBLIGATORY CONCLUSION.

They set out to make a modern Gradius and succeeded in every aspect. It's difficult but fair, and is one of the best shmups ever made I'd say. Heck, I'd say it's easily THE best I've ever played if we're talking horizontal shmups.

And it's worth mentioning that the art style is perfect for capturing the retro look in a crisp, clean way. The soundtrack is also well done and fits perfectly with the game.

So yeah, it's good. I reccomend it. I enjoy it. Thumbs up.  Go.

Super Hydorah parte de la base ya fabricada del Hydorah original de 2010. Un modo cooperativo local ha sido añadido, dándole al videojuego un nuevo enfoque, una aventura compartible que hará delicias entre los amigos. Y aún con todo, consigue destacar por sí mismo (no necesitando ser comparado constantemente a otros), consigue brillar gracias a su sistema único de secretos y su pequeño toque RPG del armamento, y toda la sensación de space-opera que desprende. Una aventura que nos emocionará ya llegando al nivel final, con varios finales y un épico desenlace si conseguimos el mejor.

35088692.review:
Bei Super Hydorah handelt es sich um eine äußerst gelungene Hommage an 80er Jahre Shoot 'em ups wie R-Type (1987) und Katakis (1988) vom talentierten, spanischen Indie-Entwickler Locomalito, der hier nach Cursed Castilla (Maldita Castilla EX) mittlerweile sein zweites kommerzielles Projekt in Zusammenarbeit mit Abylight Studios auf Steam veröffentlicht. Das Originalspiel Hydorah von 2010 ist übrigens als Freeware auf Locomalitos Homepage erhältlich (https://www.locomalito.com/hydorah.php).

Super Hydorah bringt euch klassische Arcade-Action aus der Spielhallen-Ära der 80er auf den heimischen Bildschirm. Steigt in euer Raumschiff und heizt den außerirdischen Feinden so richtig ein. Fans von Gradius oder R-Type werden den unverkennbar ähnlichen Grafik-Stil sofort erkennen, sieht der Entwickler sein Spiel doch als Tribut an die großen Klassiker des Shoot 'em up-Genres. Die insgesamt 21 Stages des Spiels, die ihr von Feinden säubern müsst, könnt ihr entweder alleine oder gemeinsam mit einem zweiten Spieler-Schiff im Koop-Modus durchspielen und auf eine große Anzahl von freischaltbaren Waffen, Power-ups und versteckten Extras zurückgreifen. Diese sollten euch das Leben gegen allerlei Gegner, inklusive den typischen Bossgegnern innerhalb des Levels, zumindest etwas erleichtern. Eine Besonderheit neben all den klassischen Features ist, dass ihr die Levels zum großen Teil frei anwählen könnt. Akkustisch angetrieben wird die horizontale Action-Ballerei dabei von einem Synthie-Soundtrack, der das Geschehen mit mehr als 60 Tracks passend untermalen soll.

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist ähnlich wie bei vielen 80er Jahre-Vorbildern relativ hoch angesetzt und nur etwas für geübte Gamer. Selbst Genre-Könner werden zahlreiche Tode sterben. Eine gewisse Frustresistenz ist hier also Voraussetzung. Das Spiel bietet aber glücklicherweise eine Continue-Funktion, wie man sie auch aus den glorreichen 80ern kennt.

Die Steuerung sowohl per Steam Controller als auch per Xbox One Controller ist absolut präzise und punktgenau. Die Pixelgrafik ist liebevoll animiert und als zusätzliches Sahnehäubchen kann in den Einstellungen aus 3 verschiedenen Grafikmodi ausgewählt werden (u.a. 4:3 mit CRT-Scanlinien) um das Retro-Feeling noch zu verbessern.

Die schon fast obligatorischen Steam-Features wie Achievements und Trading Cards sind natürlich auch vorhanden und werten die Spielerfahrung zusätzlich auf.

9/10 Punkte von meiner Seite für dieses knüppelharte aber nie unfaire Shoot 'em Up und auch zu diesem Preis eine klare Kaufempfehlung von meiner Seite!
